programme.title: NHL 4 Nations Faceoff
programme.desc: Canada needed a 5-3 win over Finland to advance to the championship; United States finished first in round-robin play, including a 3-1 win over Canada on Feb. 15 behind two goals from Jake Guentzel and two points from Dylan Larkin.

programme.title: The Point
programme.desc: Analysts cover the latest around the world of the NHL, featuring highlights from recent games, previews of upcoming marquee matchups, the newest stories making headlines and all-access footage to give viewers a unique look at their favorite players.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: Mike Greenberg, who joined ESPN in 1996 as an anchor, joins former NBA star Jalen Rose for roundtable discussions about the latest sports news making headlines as well as analysis of recent big games and interviews with expert commentators.

programme.title: NBA Countdown
programme.desc: Expert analysts preview the upcoming action in the NBA, evaluating the strengths and weaknesses of each team while breaking down the pivotal matchups; coverage includes exclusive interviews, insightful commentary and special features.

programme.title: ESPN First Take
programme.desc: Molly Qerim is the moderator while veteran commentators Stephen A. Smith and Max Kellerman discuss and deliberate the latest topics in the world of sports; the debate show also features guest appearances by entertainers, athletes and journalists.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: A panel of reporters from across the country debate trending topics and stories in sports with points being awarded for valid arguments, and at the end of the show, the winner is awarded 30 uninterrupted seconds to discuss any topic of their choice.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon, longtime colleagues and friends, engage in verbal sparring during a fast-paced and wide-ranging discussion about current events in the world of sports; Kornheiser and Wilbon also interview special guests.

programme.title: NFL2Night
programme.desc: The latest news and reports around the NFL are discussed in detail with a panel of expert analysts weighing in on the hottest issues, while veteran football reporters provide up-to-date information from team headquarters across the league.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: Malika Andrews covers the latest news from around the NBA, breaking down the stories making headlines across the league, highlights and takeaways from recent games, and guest interviews to get a unique perspective on the league.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Minnesota has claimed victories over Houston in their last two meetings, winning the most recent matchup on Feb. 6 with a 127-114 scoreline; Anthony Edwards posted 41 points and 7 rebounds for the Timberwolves in the win on the road.

programme.desc: Cleveland claimed a 110-104 victory over New York in their first meeting of the season on Oct. 28 behind 34 points and 3 assists from Darius Garland; Jalen Brunson posted 21 points and 7 assists for the Knicks in the loss at home.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 8 Iowa State (21-5, 11-4) won four-straight games behind Curtis Jones, who is third in the Big 12 with 17.2 ppg, and won four of the last five meetings; No. 5 Houston (22-4, 14-1) won its last five games, and is 13-1 at home this season.

programme.desc: No. 17 Kentucky (18-8, 7-6) won three of its last four games; No. 4 Alabama (21-5, 10-3) dropped its last two games, but leads the country in scoring, averaging 90.6 ppg behind Mark Sears, who is second in the SEC in scoring with 18.5 ppg.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The Lakers and Celtics met in the NBA Finals for the first time in 1959, and in the 1960s the two franchises battled for the title six times; Bill Russell was a dominant figure for the Celtics, and Los Angeles featured Jerry West and Elgin Baylor.

programme.desc: TCU (15-11, 8-7) won three-straight games after a 69-66 win over No. 9 Texas Tech behind Noah Reynolds; Cincinnati (15-11, 5-10) is 10-4 at home, and won all three home meetings with the Horned Frogs after an 81-77 OT win last season.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: West Virginia claimed victories over TCU in both of their meetings from the 2023-24 season, winning the final matchup on March 2 with a 57-49 scoreline; Jordan Harrison and Ja'Naiya Quinerly both had 14 points for the Mountaineers in the win.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Coverage of college basketball games.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Ron Shelton takes an in-depth look back at the motivations that led Michael Jordan to quit playing for the Chicago Bulls and pursue a career in professional baseball despite having just won three consecutive championships in the NBA.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: WNBA superstar and activist Maya Moore stepped away from the sport for a remarkable reason: to fight for a man she believed was wrongly imprisoned, devoting herself full-time to working for the release of a man named Jonathan Irons.

programme.title: Kevin Harvick's Happy Hour
programme.desc: Former NASCAR driver and 2014 Cup Series champion Kevin Harvick and his friends break down the latest news making headlines across NASCAR, going over the latest results and interview guests to gather their unique perspective on the sport.

programme.title: NHRA in 30
programme.desc: Thorough coverage of the latest NHRA events is showcased, including detailed play-by-play, replays of the most exciting and pivotal moments from the race as well as exclusive interviews, special features, insightful commentary and highlights.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: USC (14-11, 6-8) dropped three of its last four after a 69-66 loss to Minnesota; No. 20 Maryland (20-6, 10-5) is 15-1 at home, and is outscoring its opponents by 16.3 ppg behind freshman Derik Queen, who leads the team with 16 ppg.

programme.title: America's Day at the Races

programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.desc: The top 5 contenders from each region will advance to compete at The American Contender Finals at Globe Life Field in Arlington, Texas.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series Qualifying

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Inter Miami CF has won each of the two all-time meetings with Sporting Kansas City, including a 3-2 victory at Arrowhead Stadium in an MLS contest on April 13, as Luis Suárez scored the match-winner off an assist from Diego Gómez in the 71st minute.

programme.title: Saudi Pro League Soccer
programme.desc: Al-Nassr claimed a 3-0 victory over Al-Ettifaq in their first meeting of the season on Sept. 20, led by a pair of assists from Sadio Mané in the second half; Cristiano Ronaldo, Salem Alnajdi and Anderson Talisca found the net for Al-Nassr in the win.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Vancouver Whitecaps FC is just 1-1-6 over its last eight Concacaf Champions League matches after suffering a 3-0 setback to Tigres UANL on Feb. 14, 2024; Costa Rican side Deportivo Saprissa has won the tournament three times (1993, 1995, 2005).

programme.title: 2025 CONCACAF Women's U-20 Qualifiers
programme.desc: Bermuda U20 won its last CONCACAF U20 qualifier after defeating Anguilla U20, 3-1, on April 18, 2023; Trinidad & Tobago U20 seeks its best finish in the tournament since earning a fourth-place finish in the 2014 edition held in the Cayman Islands.

programme.title: Saudi Pro League Soccer
programme.desc: Al-Ahli claimed a 4-2 victory over Damac in their first meeting of the season on Sept. 20, led by a brace and assist from forward Ivan Toney; midfielder Gabri Veiga posted a goal and a pair of assists for Al-Ahli in the win at home.

programme.desc: North Queensland (0-0-1) defeated the Storm in Round 26 last season with a 38-30 victory in Round 26, as Kyle Feldt scored two tries in the first half, while Valentine Holmes had 18 points; Melbourne (0-0-1) fell to New Zealand, 36-10, on Feb. 14.

programme.title: Saudi Pro League Soccer
programme.desc: Al-Ittihad progressed past Al-Hilal in the King's Cup quarter-finals round on Jan. 7 after penalties of a 2-2 draw where forward Karim Benzema equalized for Al-Ittihad in the 24th minute of extra time; Benzema had a brace in the single-leg cup match.

programme.title: MLS Soccer
programme.desc: Minnesota and Los Angeles split victories in theri two meetings from the 2024 season with LAFC claiming a 2-0 victory in the final matchup on May 29; Denis Bouanga converted a penalty and Mateusz Bogusz made it a 2-0 lead in the second half.

programme.title: AMSOIL Championship Snocross Series
programme.desc: The top competitors from around the world compete in the AMSOIL Championship Snocross Series, the premier snowmobile racing event in North America, featuring racers competing on a track with big jumps, highlights of top moments and interviews.

programme.title: NRL Rugby League
programme.desc: Newcastle (0-0-1) suffered a 44-18 setback to Parramatta on Feb. 14; Sydney (0-0-1) has won seven of the past eight encounters against the Knights, including a 22-20 triumph last season in Round 6, as Daniel Tupou notched two tries.
